Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
city.cs.engine.Body
city.cs.engine.DynamicBody
city.cs.engine.Walker
game.entities.Enemy
Direct Known Subclasses:
FlyingEnemy
public class Enemy extends city.cs.engine.Walker
Represents an enemy character that moves back and forth and animates accordingly.

    • movementTimer

      protected Timer movementTimer
      The Timer that handles the enemy's back-and-forth movement. We store it here so we can stop/resume it when the game is paused/resumed.

    • isDestroyed

      private boolean isDestroyed
      Indicates whether this entity has already been destroyed.

      Once destroy() is called, this flag is set to true, allowing game logic to check destruction state without relying solely on the physics engineâ€™s body removal.

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(city.cs.engine.World world, org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position, float speed)
      Constructs an enemy with a given position and speed.
      Parameters:
      world - The game world the enemy exists in.
      position - The starting position of the enemy.
      speed - The movement speed of the enemy.

  • Method Details

    • loadAnimation

      private Animation loadAnimation(String prefix, int frameCount, float scale)
      Loads a series of images into an Animation object.
      Parameters:
      prefix - The prefix of the image file names.
      frameCount - The number of frames in the animation.
      scale - The scale factor for the images.
      Returns:
      A new Animation object composed of the specified images.

    • startMovement

      protected void startMovement()
      Starts the enemy movement in a back-and-forth pattern.

    • stopMovement

      public void stopMovement()
      Stops the movement timer so the enemy no longer moves. Call this when pausing the game.

    • resumeMovement

      public void resumeMovement()
      Resumes the movement timer so the enemy continues moving. Call this when resuming the game.

    • updateAnimation

      public void updateAnimation()
      Updates the currently displayed animation frame.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Marks this entity as destroyed and invokes the superclass destruction logic.

      Setting isDestroyed before calling super.destroy() ensures that any subsequent checks to isDestroyed() will accurately reflect that this object has been removed.

      Overrides:
      destroy in class city.cs.engine.Walker

    • isDestroyed

      public boolean isDestroyed()
      Checks whether this entity has been destroyed.
      Returns:
      true if destroy() has been called on this object; false otherwise.
